Comments_List: Greatly improved my speaking, writing, listening, and especially my knowledge of Russian grammar. You also develop a greater understanding of Russian culture throughout the course, which is extremely helpful if you want to travel to a Russian speaking country.
This course deepened my understanding of Russian grammar and greatly improved my conversational skills

Strengths: Only 5 people in the class and you meet everyday; you'll get plenty of individualized attention and quickly improve your Russian if you put in the work

Weaknesses: The textbook can be dry sometimes, and instruction is mostly from the book.
This course is extremely well-taught and covers a lot of material over the course of the semester. The only weakness is that it is sometimes unorganized, but I don't think this affected my learning

I wholeheartedly recommend this class to anyone who wants to learn Russian. The class is as hard or as easy as you want it to bethe homework takes around 30 minutes a night, but there is additional work you can do if you want to improve even more quickly. The professor and the TA are wonderful people who are more than happy to meet with you whenever you want; both have genuine interests in trying to improve your Russian, which forms a great support system.
I would recommend this course to anyone who enjoys a challenge and is looking to improve their Russian. There is a heavy workload for this course, but it is rewarding.

Yes! The Russian department here is great, very personal and very invested in your learning. Plus, Professor Dolgova is absolutely incredible. She's one of my favorite teachers by far. And Ingrid is just the best TA.
